title: The Growing Gap Between Fossil Fuel Use and Finds
summary: Herbert Stein was an American economist who served in both the Nixon and Ford administrations. He is probably most famous for formulating Stein's Law, namely, "If something cannot go on forever, it will stop." This is, of course, an obvious statement. title: U.S. Natural Gas Prices Hit $6 For First Time Since 2022 amid Big Freeze
summary: U.S. natural gas prices on Monday extended their remarkable 70% rally from last week as the big freeze pushes heating and power demand to winter records.
